ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: sums the first thirteen que's

ElementDescription: How many separate times in your life have you been depressed nearly every day for at least two weeks and had several of the symptoms you listed?
Notes: 1= 1; 2= 2-3; 3 = Several; 4 = All of my life / as long as I can remember; -9 = Do Not know/ Prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: About how old were you the first time you had a period of two weeks like this? (Whether or not you received any help for it.)
Notes: Age in Years

ElementDescription: Did any of these episodes occur within the first year of giving birth?

ElementDescription: Has it ever been suggested that you have postpartum depression?
Notes: 1= Yes; 0= No; -9 = Do Not know/ Prefer not to answer; -99 = Not applicable

Notes: 1 = Mark ALL that you have experienced; 2= Mark ALL that occurred during the same period of time when symptoms were at their worst; 3= Both; 4= Neither; 999= Not Applicable

Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; -9 = Do Not know/ Prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: What is the longest period of time that this kind of worrying has ever continued?
Notes: 1= Less than 6 months; 2= Between 6 and 12 months; 3= Between 1 and 5 years; 4= more than 5 years; 5= All of my life/as long as I can remember

ElementDescription: People differ a lot in how much they worry about things. Did you ever have a time when you worried a lot more than most people would in your situation?

ElementDescription: Please think of the period in your life when you have felt worried, tense, anxious, or more worried than most people would in your situation. This could be in the past, or it could be continuing now.  During that period, was your worry stronger than in other people?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; -9 = Do Not know/ Prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: Please think of the period in your life when you have felt worried, tense, anxious, or more worried than most people would in your situation. This could be in the past, or it could be continuing now. Did you worry most days?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; -9 = Do Not know/ Prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: Please think of the period in your life when you have felt worried, tense, anxious, or more worried than most people would in your situation. This could be in the past, or it could be continuing now. Did you usually worry about one particular thing, such as job security or the failing health of a loved one, or about more than one thing?

ElementDescription: Please think of the period in your life when you have felt worried, tense, anxious, or more worried than most people would in your situation. This could be in the past, or it could be continuing now. Did you find it difficult to stop worrying?

ElementDescription: Please think of the two-week period in your life when your feelings of depression or loss of interest were the worst: How much of the day did these feelings usually last?
Notes: 1 = All day long; 2 = Most of the day; 3 = About half of the day; 4=Less than half of the day; -9 = Do Not know / Prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: Please think of the period in your life when you have felt worried, tense, anxious, or more worried than most people would in your situation. ElementDescription: Please think of the period in your life when you have felt worried, tense, anxious, or more worried than most people would in your situation. This could be in the past, or it could be continuing now. How often did you find it difficult to control your worrying?
Notes: 3= Often; 2= Sometimes; 1= Rarely; 0= Never; -9= Do Not know/ Prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: In what language did you collect the data?

ElementDescription: Please think of the two-week period in your life when your feelings of depression or loss of interest were the worst: Did you feel more tired or low-energy than usual nearly every day?

ElementDescription: During the two-week period in your life when these feelings were the worst: Did your weight change? (do not include weight change as a side-effect of medication you were taking)
Notes: 1= Gained weight (by about 10 lbs or more); 2= Lost weight (by about 10 lbs or more); 3= Both gained weight and lost weight during the same depression episode; 4= Stayed about the same| -9 = Do Not know/ Prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: Please think of the period in your life when you have felt worried, tense, anxious, or more worried than most people would in your situation. This could be in the past, or it could be continuing now. Did you usually worry about one particular thing, such as job security or the failing health of a loved one, or about more than one thing?
